content:
AuthorizationRuleCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of AuthorizationRule objects. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Configuration.ConfigurationCollection(typeof(System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule), AddItemName="allow,deny", CollectionType=System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollectionType.BasicMapAlternate)]
public sealed class AuthorizationRuleCollection : System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ConfigurationElement
  • System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection
  • AuthorizationRuleCollection

Remarks

The AuthorizationRuleCollection type allows access to the elements of the authorization section collection.

Initializes a new instance of the AuthorizationRuleCollection class.

    Gets the type of this AuthorizationRuleCollection.

    Property Value

      A value from the ConfigurationElementCollectionType enumeration representing the type of this collection.

  • ElementName

    public System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule this[int index] { get; set; }

    • index

      AuthorizationRule collection index

      The AuthorizationRule at the specified index.

  • Properties

    Property Value

      To be added.

Methods

  • Add(AuthorizationRule)

    Adds a AuthorizationRule object to the collection.

    public void Add (System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule rule);

    Parameters

    • rule
      AuthorizationRule

      The AuthorizationRule object to add to the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ConfigurationException

      The AuthorizationRule object already exists in the collection, or the collection is read-only.

    Remarks

    The collection must not already contain the AuthorizationRule object you are adding.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Add method. 

                // Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Add method.
           
            // Set the action property.
            authorizationRule.Action = 
               AuthorizationRuleAction.Allow;
            // Define the new rule to add to the collection.
            authorizationRule.Users.Add("userName");
            authorizationRule.Roles.Add("admin");
            authorizationRule.Verbs.Add("POST");

            // Add the new rule to the collection.
            authorizationSection.Rules.Add(authorizationRule);

          ' Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Add method.
      ' Set the action property.
        authorizationRule.Action = _
        AuthorizationRuleAction.Allow
      ' Define the new rule to add to the collection.
      authorizationRule.Users.Add("userName")
      authorizationRule.Roles.Add("admin")
      authorizationRule.Verbs.Add("POST")
      
      ' Add the new rule to the collection.
      authorizationSection.Rules.Add(authorizationRule)
  • Clear()

    Removes all AuthorizationRule objects from the collection.

    public void Clear ();

    Remarks

    This method inserts a clear directive into the appropriate section of the configuration file to clear all references to elements defined in a higher-level configuration file. All elements defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file are removed.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Clear method. 

                // Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Clear method.
            authorizationSection.Rules.Clear();

          ' Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Clear method.
      authorizationSection.Rules.Clear()

  • Get(Int32)

    Gets the AuthorizationRule at the specified index.

    public System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule Get (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The AuthorizationRule index.

    Returns

    • AuthorizationRule

      The AuthorizationRule at the specified index.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Get method. Refer to the code example in the AuthorizationSection class topic to learn how to get the collection. 

                // Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Get method.
            AuthorizationRule authRule = 
                authorizationRuleCollection.Get(0);

          ' Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Get method.
        Dim authRule As AuthorizationRule = _
        authorizationRuleCollection.Get(0)
  • GetElementKey(ConfigurationElement)
    protected override object GetElementKey (System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement element);

    Parameters

    • element
      ConfigurationElement

      To be added.

    Returns

    • Object

      To be added.

  • IndexOf(AuthorizationRule)

    Gets the collection index of the specified AuthorizationRule object.

    public int IndexOf (System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule rule);

    Parameters

    • rule
      AuthorizationRule

      The AuthorizationRule object whose index is returned.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index of the specified AuthorizationRule object.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the IndexOf method. 

                // Get the rule collection index.
            System.Int32 ruleIndex = 
                authorizationSection.Rules.IndexOf(authorizationRule);

          ' Get the rule collection index.
        Dim ruleIndex As System.Int32 = _
        authorizationSection.Rules.IndexOf(authorizationRule)
  • IsElementName(String)
    protected override bool IsElementName (string elementname);

    Parameters

    • elementname
      String

      To be added.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      To be added.

  • Remove(AuthorizationRule)

    Removes a AuthorizationRule object from the collection.

    public void Remove (System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule rule);

    Parameters

    • rule
      AuthorizationRule

      The AuthorizationRule object to remove.

    Exceptions

    • ConfigurationException

      The passed AuthorizationRule object does not exist in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.

    Remarks

    This method inserts a remove element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Remove method. Refer to the code example in the AuthorizationSection class topic to learn how to get the collection. 

                // Remove the rule from the collection.
            authorizationSection.Rules.Remove(authorizationRule);

          ' Remove the rule from the collection.
      authorizationSection.Rules.Remove(authorizationRule)
  • RemoveAt(Int32)

    Removes a AuthorizationRule object from the collection at the specified index.

    public void RemoveAt (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index location of the AuthorizationRule to remove.

    Exceptions

    • ConfigurationException

      There is no AuthorizationRule object with the specified index in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.

    Remarks

    This method inserts a remove element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the RemoveAt method. Refer to the code example in the AuthorizationSection class topic to learn how to get the collection. 

                // Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection RemoveAt method.
            authorizationRuleCollection.RemoveAt(0);

          ' Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection RemoveAt method.
      authorizationRuleCollection.RemoveAt(0)
  • Set(Int32,AuthorizationRule)

    Adds the specified AuthorizationRule object to the collection at the specified index.

    public void Set (int index, System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule rule);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index location at which to add the specified AuthorizationRuleCollection object.

    • rule
      AuthorizationRule

      The AuthorizationRule object to be added.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Set method. 

                // Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Set method.

            // Define the rule to add to the collection.

            // Define the collection index.
            System.Int32 rIndex = 0;

            // Set the rule in the collection.
            authorizationRuleCollection.Set(rIndex, 
                authorizationRule);

          ' Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Set method.
      ' Define the rule to add to the collection.
      ' Define the collection index.
      Dim rIndex As System.Int32 = 0
      
      ' Set the rule in the collection.
        authorizationRuleCollection.Set(rIndex, _
        authorizationRule)
